Title.En: New ideas to revolutionize the Future of Plant-Based food

Description.En: The challenge is to find solutions to lead the next revolution in sustainable eating, by transforming the culinary landscape with MOPUR, a groundbreaking vegetarian alternative to meat. Created from gluten and legumes and enriched with the natural fermentation of Lactobacillus plantarum and Saccharomyces cerevisiae, MOPUR offers a delicious, eco-friendly solution to high carbon footprints and meat consumption. In this challenge, we will delve into the innovative production technology of MOPUR, explore current market, and understand the complexities of food logistics, boost creativity to develop new food preparations that move beyond traditional salami-like products and focus on marketing messages that resonate with modern consumers and drive the adoption of sustainable eating habits.

NoteLiteral.En: Forecast the long-term impacts of technological, environmental, and societal changes on the evolution of plant-based foods.
Explain the current trends, challenges, and opportunities in the plant-based food industry.
Design and conceptualize new plant-based food products that address current market gaps and consumer needs.

Title.En: New ideas to revolutionize the Future of Plant-Based food
New ideas to revolutionize the Future of Plant-Based food

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The challenge is to create  new food preparations and marketing strategies for MOPUR, a sustainable vegetarian alternative to meat salami. Participants will explore MOPUR production, legislation, and logistics, and develop market-ready products and compelling marketing messages with experts.

- Introduction to MOPUR and challenge-based learning; team formation and brainstorming.

- Market and consumer trends; market analysis, Production technology and legislative framework, logistics.

- Ideation and prototyping; hands-on product development.

- Marketing strategies and communication; creating marketing campaigns.

- Final presentations and feedback; refining strategies and implementation planning.

**Evaluation**

- Participation and Collaboration: 20%

- Reports: 30%

- Final Presentation: 30%

**Resources**

- Online course materials

- Access to a food production lab

- Guest lectures from experts

**Instructors and Support**

- Expert in food science and technology

- Guest lecturers (market analysts, marketing professionals, legal experts)

- Support from teaching assistants and lab technicians

**Physical presence in Trento is required from 11 to 15 November.**

**If you are an international student, ask for financial support from the mobility office of your home university, mentioning that this learning opportunity can be a BIP (Blended Intensive Program).**

More information **[here](https://www.soi.unitn.it/courses/soi-142-new-ideas-to-revolutionize-the-future-of-plant-based-food/)**!
Be a trailblazer in the world of plant-based foods!

The consumption of meat has high footprint and carbon emissions and veg alternatives are receiving increasing attention by the food industries and the consumers.

Register now to participate in this transformative challenge to redefine the future of plant-based food based on MOPUR. Let's innovate, collaborate, and make a lasting impact on the food industry together!
The challenge will cover various areas: Develop original food preparations utilizing MOPUR that appeal to diverse palates; Create effective marketing strategies to position MOPUR as a leading choice in plant-based nutrition; Understand and apply knowledge in food production, legislation, and logistics to real-world challenges; Foster a collaborative environment where teamwork and diverse perspectives drive innovation; Prototype and test new solutions directly with consumers to ensure market readiness.

To apply for the Challenge, please upload:

- your CV in English;

- if available, the English language certification

- a brief motivational letter (1.000 characters) OR a motivational video (max 40’’, preferably youtube link) where you explain WHY you are interested in THIS Challenge.

- Transcript of records

Please identify your Applicant status:

1-UniTrento PhD or Student

 2-ECIU student

 3-Erasmus+ or Bilateral agreement student (in Trento for the whole semester)

4-Student enrolled in Erasmus+ (non ECIU) partner University, applying for a challenge or BIP-Blended Intensive Program in Trento

5-Other (extra fees may apply)

Status 1, 2 and 3 applicants need to submit two applications (similar documents, same deadline on 25 September):

[SOI Admission Apply](https://webapps.unitn.it/Apply/it/MyUnitn/Home/334102/serv-studenti/Sel_SoI_2024_1)

[ECIU Admission application](https://engage.eciu.eu/browse?universityIds=c7bc8551-6a54-ed11-bba2-6045bd886566&learningOppStatuses=1)

Status 4 and 5 applicants only submit their application in the[SOI Admission Apply](https://webapps.unitn.it/Apply/it/MyUnitn/Home/334102/serv-studenti/Sel_SoI_2024_1)

[Here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1p_7yzGdwBz1VL5Tq86o03TM7zG47B7yT/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=117641408050668552988&rtpof=true&sd=true)you can find guidelines on the application process.
